description: The function 'draw_stats_scatterplot' generates a scatterplot of data points and a line of best fit. It differentiates points that lie on the line from those that do not, providing a visual representation of statistical correlation and regression analysis.

educational_standards.description: Use the equation of a linear model to solve problems in the context of bivariate measurement data. Interpret the significance of the slope and intercept in the context of the problem.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Scatterplot and Line of Best Fit
stimulus_type_specification.description: The function 'draw_stats_scatterplot' can draw a scatterplot of data points and a line of best fit. It accepts input of type 'StatsScatterplot', which includes a list of points and a line of best fit. Each point is defined by its x and y coordinates, while the line of best fit is defined by its slope and intercept. The function validates that all points are unique and within a specified range, and that the provided line of best fit closely matches the actual one. This visualization serves to illustrate the concept of statistical correlation and regression analysis, making it a valuable tool in the field of data science education.

details: The 'points' field accepts a list of 'Point' objects, each defined by 'x' and 'y' coordinates.
The 'line_of_best_fit' field accepts a 'LineOfBestFit' object, defined by its 'slope' and 'intercept'.
The 'points' field must contain between 5 and 15 unique points.
All point coordinates must be within the range of -15 to 15.
The provided line of best fit must match the actual line of best fit within a tolerance of 0.5 for both slope and intercept.
The function draws a scatterplot of data points and a line of best fit.
Points that lie on the line are colored red, while those that do not are colored black.
The line of best fit is drawn in blue.
